data.title: To Have and Have Not: The Dower of Joanna Plantagenet, Queen of Sicily (1177–1189)
data.meta_description: This article will examine the dower portion given to Joanna Plantagenet, the youngest daughter of Henry II of England and Eleanor of Aquitaine, on her marriage to William II of Sicily, as a means to assess how much access to power and authority this may have given...
